author:
Shane Covey
scovey@reformer.com @ShaneCovey on Twitter
title: Terriers sink Solons, 3-0
text:
Posted: 10/25/2015 08:13:44 PM EDT Updated: 10/25/2015 08:13:45 PM EDT Click photo to enlarge Bellows Falls' Leia Robinson tries to get the ball past Montpelier goalie Emily Bashara during Friday's Division 3 field hockey quarterfinal in Westminster. « 1 » 
WESTMINSTER >> A newspaper reporter jokingly asked Bethany Coursen to spell "Missisquoi Valley" — her next opponent — during an interview following Friday's Division 3 field hockey quarterfinal. 
It happened to be the only real challenge that the Bellows Falls coach faced all day. 
The top-seeded Terriers had a 13-0 advantage in penalty corners and outshot No. 8 Montpelier 25-0 during a lopsided 3-0 victory. 
"It was nice to see us keeping the pressure on them," stated Coursen. "I thought their goalie was doing a good job all day long." 
Emily Bashara was peppered for the majority of the contest and finished with 22 saves. Montpelier's back line of Anisa Venner-Johnston, Amber Pagani, Grace Carlomagno and Jordan Allen-Brandon was under attack from start to finish and had to be exhausted from all of the penalty corner sprints. 
"My front line is relentless, but we need to work on getting it in the net. To some extent, they like to pass too much," noted coach Coursen. 
Leia Robinson and Reagan Baldasaro each excited the crowd with long rallies, while Abbe Cravinho and Molly Kelly made a beautiful dishes early in the first half. Molly Kelly threatened often, but was denied from point-blank range and later on a couple of breakaways. 
Aly Bashaw, Averie Lowe and Emily Stoddard all did a nice job of keeping the ball in the Montpelier zone. On BF's seventh corner of the game, Madison Streeter passed the ball up top to Stoddard, whose blast was kicked away by Bashara before Cravinho was able to bury her rebound attempt with 1:14 left before the break. Advertisement 
Bellows Falls goalie Brigid Hodsden was never tested. She had a good view of forwards Cravinho, Baldasaro, Robinson and Hannah Kelly passing and pressuring the Solons for the entire second half. 
Hannah Kelly made it 2-0 with 18:17 remaining, when she took a nice entry pass from Cravinho and beat Basharo one-on-one. And Robinson capped the scoring six minutes later, when she cleaned up on a Hannah Kelly laser that was deflected by the Montpelier goalie. 
Bellows Falls, which improved to 11-2-2, will face No. 4 Missisquoi Valley (5-7-3) in Wednesday's semifinal in Manchester at 3:45 p.m. Second-seeded Stowe and No. 3 Lyndon will square off on the other side of the bracket.
